## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`resolvconf`](#resolvconf): Manage resolv.conf configuration
* [`resolvconf::config`](#resolvconf--config): Class to configure the resolv.conf file. This class should not be called directly.
* [`resolvconf::install`](#resolvconf--install): resolvconf::install  Class to install resolvconf package on Debian based systems resolvconf::install  Class to install resolvconf package on 
* [`resolvconf::service`](#resolvconf--service): Class for managing the systemd-resolved service

## Classes

### <a name="resolvconf"></a>`resolvconf`

resolvconf

Main class for managing resolv.conf

This module configures DNS resolution via `systemd-resolved`or directly manages /etc/resolv.conf

#### Examples

##### using systemd-resolved and defaults

```puppet
include resolvconf
```

##### Directly managing /etc/resolv.conf

```puppet
class { 'resolvconf':
  use_systemd_resolved => false,
  use_local            => false,
  dns                  => ['8.8.8.8', '1.1.1.1'],
  domains              => ['example.com'],
  options              => ['ndots:5'],
}
```

##### Using hiera configuration

```puppet
include resolvconf

hiera config:
  resolvconf::use_systemd_resolved: true
  resolvconf::use_local: true
  resolvconf::dns: ['8.8.8.8', '1.1.1.1']
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `resolvconf` class:

* [`dns`](#-resolvconf--dns)
* [`domains`](#-resolvconf--domains)
* [`use_local`](#-resolvconf--use_local)
* [`options`](#-resolvconf--options)
* [`use_systemd_resolved`](#-resolvconf--use_systemd_resolved)
* [`fallback_dns`](#-resolvconf--fallback_dns)
* [`dns_stub_listener_extra`](#-resolvconf--dns_stub_listener_extra)

##### <a name="-resolvconf--dns"></a>`dns`

Data type: `Array[Variant[String, Float], 1]`

Array containing the nameservers to put in resolv.conf (default: ['8.8.8.8','1.1.1.1'])

##### <a name="-resolvconf--domains"></a>`domains`

Data type: `Array[String, 1]`

The domains to include in the search line in resolv.conf

##### <a name="-resolvconf--use_local"></a>`use_local`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether to use a local DNS listener for systemd-resolved or local dns service (default: true)

##### <a name="-resolvconf--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array containing the options to put in resolv.conf. Not applicable when use_systemd_resolved is true

##### <a name="-resolvconf--use_systemd_resolved"></a>`use_systemd_resolved`

Data type: `Boolean`

Use systemd-resolved for managing resolv.conf

##### <a name="-resolvconf--fallback_dns"></a>`fallback_dns`

Data type: `Array[Variant[String, Float]]`

allback_dns [Array[Variant[String, Float]]
Array containing fallback nameservers to put in resolv.conf
Default value is an empty array.

##### <a name="-resolvconf--dns_stub_listener_extra"></a>`dns_stub_listener_extra`

Data type: `Array[Variant[String, Float]]`

ns_stub_listener_extra [Array[Variant[String, Float]]
An array of strings or floats, with at least one element, representing
additional DNS stub listener configurations.
Default value is an empty array.

### <a name="resolvconf--config"></a>`resolvconf::config`

resolvconf::config

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `resolvconf::config` class:

* [`use_systemd_resolved`](#-resolvconf--config--use_systemd_resolved)
* [`use_local`](#-resolvconf--config--use_local)
* [`dns`](#-resolvconf--config--dns)
* [`fallback_dns`](#-resolvconf--config--fallback_dns)
* [`dns_stub_listener_extra`](#-resolvconf--config--dns_stub_listener_extra)
* [`domains`](#-resolvconf--config--domains)
* [`options`](#-resolvconf--config--options)

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--use_systemd_resolved"></a>`use_systemd_resolved`

Data type: `Boolean`

Use systemd-resolved for managing resolv.conf

Default value: `$resolvconf::use_systemd_resolved`

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--use_local"></a>`use_local`

Data type: `Boolean`

Use local DNS resolver

Default value: `$resolvconf::use_local`

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--dns"></a>`dns`

Data type: `Array[Variant[String, Float], 1]`

List of DNS servers

Default value: `$resolvconf::dns`

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--fallback_dns"></a>`fallback_dns`

Data type: `Array[Variant[String, Float]]`

allback_dns [Array[Variant[String, Float]]
List of fallback DNS servers

Default value: `$resolvconf::fallback_dns`

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--dns_stub_listener_extra"></a>`dns_stub_listener_extra`

Data type: `Array[Variant[String, Float]]`

ns_stub_listener_extra [Array[Variant[String, Float]]
Extra DNS stub listener options

Default value: `$resolvconf::dns_stub_listener_extra`

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--domains"></a>`domains`

Data type: `Array[String, 1]`

List of search domains

Default value: `$resolvconf::domains`

##### <a name="-resolvconf--config--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Array[String]`

List of resolver options to add to resolv.conf

Default value: `$resolvconf::options`

### <a name="resolvconf--install"></a>`resolvconf::install`

resolvconf::install

Class to install resolvconf package on Debian based systems
resolvconf::install

Class to install resolvconf package on Debian based systems

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `resolvconf::install` class:

* [`use_systemd_resolved`](#-resolvconf--install--use_systemd_resolved)

##### <a name="-resolvconf--install--use_systemd_resolved"></a>`use_systemd_resolved`

Data type: `Boolean`

Boolean to determine if systemd-resolved should be used

Default value: `$resolvconf::use_systemd_resolved`

### <a name="resolvconf--service"></a>`resolvconf::service`

resolvconf::service

A description of what this class does

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `resolvconf::service` class:

* [`use_systemd_resolved`](#-resolvconf--service--use_systemd_resolved)

##### <a name="-resolvconf--service--use_systemd_resolved"></a>`use_systemd_resolved`

Data type: `Boolean`

Determine if systemd-resolved should be used

Default value: `$resolvconf::use_systemd_resolved`
